title: Conway chained arrow notation
summary: Conway chained arrow notation, created by mathematician John Horton Conway, is a means of expressing certain extremely large numbers.[1] It is simply a finite sequence of positive integers separated by rightward arrows, e.g. 2 → 3 → 4 → 5 → 6 {\displaystyle 2\to 3\to 4\to 5\to 6} .
